results.title: Wherever she goes
results.creator_credit: Michael S. Gordon and Faun Films
results.brief_description: A film biography of Eileen Joyce, the celebrated Australian pianist concentrating on her childhood in the Tasmanian bush and the Kalgoorlie goldfields. Opening and closing scenes show the pianist herself performing at a concert. Made in Australia by the British Production House Ealing Studios.

results.title: Room for one more
results.creator_credit: Barry Milligan and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Victoria Templeton interviews couples who have adopted or fostered disabled children in infancy or early childhood. Discusses the joys and issues surrounding caring for emotionally, physically or intellectually disabled children and emphasises the importance of family relationships.

results.title: King Lear
results.creator_credit: Sir Laurence Olivier, Granada Television International and Michael Elliott
results.brief_description: Sir Laurence Olivier stars as King Lear in this interpretation of Shakespeare’s‘ majestic tragedy of misplaced trust and filial ingratitude. Co-starring Diana Rigg, Leo McKern and John Hurt.

results.title: Teacher and technology
results.creator_credit: U-Tel, South Australian Film Corporation and Milton Ingerson
results.brief_description: Aims to promote technology awarness in teachers. Changes in needs and methods have led to a greater use of technology in the classroom, especially for self-paced learning. The practical applications of equipment are discussed. Children from four South Australian primary schools participated in the production. Essentially a promotion of the South Australian Educational Technology Centre. It emphasizes the need to teach using 1980s technology. Hardware covered includes over-head projectors, computers, video, film.

results.title: Pete's pigs: a journey through an intensive piggery
results.brief_description: Provides comparison between a mechanized piggery and the traditional method of running a piggery, noting the vast improvements in the control of disease and breeding that have come with automation. No other credits.

results.title: Tale of two cities
results.creator_credit: Ralph Thomas, Betty E. Box and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Charles Dickens’ immortal tale of romance and intrigue set against the lurid background of the French Revolution. Dirk Bogarde stars as Sydney Carlton whose final act of self-sacrifice brings the story to its dramatic end. Also stars Dorothy Tutin and Cecil Parker, Leo McKern, Christopher Lee and Donald Pleasence.

results.title: Running high: a story of pain and joy ...
results.creator_credit: Gus Howard and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Novices and champions prepare for, and run the 1983 Festival City Marathon. Robert de Castella intersperses candid interviews with his marathon running philosophy and techniques. Discusses the exhilaration of personal improvement, the disappointment of hitting the wall and the reasons behind the increasing popularity of running throughout the world.

results.title: Nicholas Nickleby
results.creator_credit: Alberto Cavalcanti, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
Features the British film production house Ealing Studios adaptation of the classic tale by Charles Dickens. Stars Derek Bond as Nicholas Nickleby, Sybil Thorndike as Mrs. Squeers, Sir Cedric Hardwicke as the steely hearted uncle and Stanley Holloway as the earthy thespian Vincent Crummels.

results.title: The Transition tapes
results.brief_description: These tapes are intended to aid the Transition Education evaluation process by raising relevant questions and issues. They enable re-assessment of attitudes to learning and resources, employment and unemployment from five viewpoints : student, teacher, community, employer and school administrator. No other credits available.

results.title: Equal opportunity tapes
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Nicholas Cockram
results.brief_description: Emphasises the importance of equal opportunity to both male and female teachers. Tape 1. Introduces and defines the concept of equal opportunity. 2. Designed to show what the real world is about for women. 3. Attempts to encourage teachers to examine, analyse and consider altering their classroom practice.
